official_title: Phase III Randomized Trial of Standard Systemic Therapy (SST) Versus Standard Systemic Therapy Plus Definitive Treatment (Surgery or Radiation) of the Primary Tumor in Metastatic Prostate Cancer
brief_title: Standard Systemic Therapy With or Without Definitive Treatment in Treating Participants With Metastatic Prostate Cancer
cancer_type_display: A study for participants with metastatic prostate cancer, comparing standard systemic therapy alone to standard systemic therapy combined with definitive treatment (surgery or radiation) of the primary tumor.
cancer_tags: Stage IV Prostate Cancer AJCC v8
Stage IVA Prostate Cancer AJCC v8
Stage IVB Prostate Cancer AJCC v8
prior_treatments_excluded: Prior local therapy for prostate adenocarcinoma (e.g., brachytherapy, HIFU, cryotherapy, laser ablative therapies)

key_inclusion_summary: Histologically or cytologically proven diagnosis of adenocarcinoma of the prostate.
Must have evidence of metastatic disease.
Must have an intact prostate with no prior local therapy for prostate cancer.
Must have received between 22 and 28 weeks of standard systemic therapy (SST) without disease progression.
key_exclusion_summary: Pure small cell carcinoma, sarcomatoid, or squamous cell carcinoma.
Prior malignancy unless disease free for three years (with exceptions).
Evidence of disease progression during the initial 22-28 weeks of SST.
Testosterone level must be < 50 ng/dL prior to randomization.
